translation: Hmm...

japanese: むむむ……。
translation: Mmmmhhh...

japanese:
なんだ、２人で難しい顔して。
どうかしたのか？
translation:
What's with those serious faces, you two?
Is something wrong?

japanese: あっ、上杉君。
translation: Ah, Uesugi-kun.

japanese: 別にどうもしてはいませんが……。
translation: Nothing's really wrong...

japanese:
いや、どう見ても
なにかあった顔をしてるが？
translation:
Well, it definitely looks like something's up.
Your faces are giving it away.

japanese: 本当に、大したことではないのですよ。
translation: It's really nothing important.

japanese:
先ほど買い物をした際に、店員の方から
『ちゅらかーぎーな双子さんだ』と言われたのです。
translation:
When we were shopping earlier, the store clerk
told us we are 'churakagi' twins.

japanese:
恐らく沖縄の言葉だと思うのですが、
その意味がわからずモヤモヤしてしまって。
translation:
I think it's a word in Okinawan dialect,
but I don't understand the meaning,
and it's bothering me.

japanese: 上杉君はどういう意味か知っていますか？
translation: Do you know what it means, Uesugi-kun?

japanese:
いや、俺も詳しくないからな。
看板や広告の宣伝文句で見る言葉くらいしか……。
translation:
No, I'm not that familiar with it either.
Just some words I've seen
in signs and advertisements...

japanese:
あっ、看板といえば！
ここの水族館の名前は
『美ら海（ちゅらうみ）水族館』ですよね。
translation:
Ah, speaking of signs!
The name of the aquarium here is
'Churaumi Aquarium,' right?

japanese: もしかして、その『ちゅら』と同じなのでは？
translation: Could it be related to THAT 'chura'?

japanese: ああ、それはありそうだな。
translation: Ah, that's possible.

japanese:
『美ら海』は『美しい海』のことだったはず。
だから『美しい』って意味じゃないか？
translation:
'Churaumi' should mean 'beautiful sea.'
So it could mean 'beautiful', right?

japanese: それはつまり、『美人』ということ……でしょうか？
translation:
So, in other words, it could mean 
'beautiful person'...perhaps?

japanese:
まあ……。
褒められていたのですね。
translation:
Well then...
It seems like we were being complimented.

japanese:
褒めていただいていたのに
まったくわからなかったなんて、
少し申し訳ないです。
translation:
I feel kind of bad that we didn't realize 
we were being praised.

japanese:
それは仕方ないだろ。
俺たちにとっちゃ初耳な単語ばかりなんだし。
translation:
Well, there's nothing we can do about it.
These words are all new to us.

japanese:
沖縄に来ていくつかは覚えましたが、
まだまだわからない言葉が多いですね。
translation:
I've learned a few things since coming to Okinawa,
but there are still many words I don't understand.

japanese: 例えば、どんなのを覚えたんだ？
translation: For example, what have you learned?

japanese:
いらっしゃいませは『めんそーれ』。
ありがとうは『にふぇーでーびる』。
translation:
'Mensoore' means 'welcome.'
'Niffee debiru' means 'thank you.'

japanese:
ゆっくりしていって、は
『よんなーよんなー』でしたね。
translation: 'Yonna yonna' means 'take it easy,' I think.

japanese:
なるほど。
買い食いの成果が出てるみたいだな。
translation:
I see.
Looks like your shopping and eating spree paid off.

japanese: 別にそういうわけではありませんが？
translation: Isn't that what it's all about though?

japanese:
まあ、観光客相手に使う言葉は、
どうしても偏りがちになるでしょうし。
translation:
Well, words used for tourists
tend to be biased, aren't they?

japanese:
それもそうか。
俺はほとんど買い物してなかったからな。
translation:
That's true, huh.
I hardly did any shopping myself.

japanese:
寂しいことを言わないでください……。
怒る気が失せてしまったじゃないですか。
translation:
Please don't say such sad things...
I've lost the will to be angry.

japanese:
いまからでも覚えるようにしておくと、
なにかと便利かもしれませんよ。
translation:
You can still try to learn them now.
It might be useful in the future.

japanese:
まあ、相手の言ってる意味がわからないと
対応に困っちまうし。
translation:
Well, if you don't understand
what the other person is saying,
it can be difficult to respond.

japanese:
いまはスマホで調べちまえば１発なんだろうが、
やっぱり不便ではあるよな。
会話は意思疎通の基本だ。
translation:
Even though we can just look it up
on our phones now, it's still inconvenient.
Communication is the foundation of understanding.

japanese:
もし言葉が通じなくなってしまったら、
私たちはどうすればいいのでしょうね。
translation:
If we weren't able to communicate with words,
what would we do?

japanese:
私たち姉妹はお互いのことが
なんとなくわかりますし、
なんとかなりそうな気もしますが……。
translation:
As sisters, we more or less understand each other,
so we might be able to figure something out...

japanese: そうでしょうか？
translation: Do you really think so?

japanese: えっ？
translation: Huh?

japanese: いまはこうして同じ格好をしていますが――
translation: Even though we're dressed the same now%p-2;――

japanese:
もう子どもの頃のように、
同じ外見、同じ性格ではありませんよね？
translation:
Our personalities are completely different.
It's not like when we were kids and were all the same.

japanese:
そんな仮定の話は意味ないだろ。
急に言葉が通じなくなるなんて、
あり得ないことを想像してもな。
translation:
That hypothetical scenario doesn't really matter.
Something as unrealistic as suddenly not being
able to communicate isn't even worth considering.

japanese:
それもそうですね。
いまの話は忘れてください。
translation:
Well, that's true.
Please just forget what we were talking about then.

japanese: 結局、みんな少しずつ変わっていくのですね。
translation:
After all, everyone changes
little by little, don't they?

japanese:
でも、この先どんなに
変わっていったとしても、私は……。
translation:
Yet, no matter how much we change in the future,
I will still be...

japanese:
容姿や性格なんて、生きてりゃ変わっていくもんだ。
それは避けられないことだろ。
translation:
Things like appearance and personality
change as we live.
That's inevitable.

japanese:
変わっちまったその先で
見つけられるものだってあるんだしな。
translation:
But even after you've changed,
there are still things you can discover, right?

japanese:
そうですね。
それは身に沁みています。
translation: Yes, I can relate to that.

japanese:
まあでも、言語まで変わっちまうことは
そうそうないと思うぞ？
translation:
Well, I don't think it's very likely
that you'll suddenly stop being able
to communicate in your language, is it?

japanese:
仮定の話ですから。
気にしないでください。
translation:
It's just a hypothetical scenario.
Don't worry about it.

japanese: 結局、みんな少しずつ変わっていくのですね。
translation:
After all, everyone changes
little by little, don't they?

japanese:
でも、この先どんなに
変わっていったとしても、私は……。
translation:
Yet, no matter how much we change in the future,
I will still be...

japanese:
同じでなくても理解してるってことじゃないのか？
ここまで五月の真似ができるんだ。
translation:
Even if we're not the same,
isn't understanding each other the most important thing?
You're able to imitate Itsuki to this degree.

japanese: まあ、そうですね。
translation: Well, I suppose.

japanese:
理解と納得は別物ですが……
なんといっても、私たちは五つ子ですから。
translation:
Understanding and accepting
are different things...
but we're quintuplets, after all.

japanese: おかげでこっちは面倒くさくて仕方ないが。
translation: That makes things such a hassle for me, though.

japanese:
そう言わずに、もう少し理解しようと
努力してみてはどうですか？
translation:
Instead of saying that,
why don't you try to make an effort
to understand a little better?

japanese: まあ……そうかもな。
translation: Well... Maybe you're right.

japanese: 結局、みんな少しずつ変わっていくのですね。
translation:
After all, everyone changes
little by little, don't they?

japanese:
でも、この先どんなに
変わっていったとしても、私は……。
translation:
Yet, no matter how much we change in the future,
I will still be...

japanese: （……この感じ、どこか二乃っぽいな）
translation:
(...This feeling,
 it's somewhat reminiscent of Nino.)

japanese: あっ……。
translation: Ah...

japanese:
……そうです！
もし言葉が通じなくなったら、
代わりにジェスチャーを使うのはどうでしょう？
translation:
I see!
If we ever can't communicate with words,
how about we use gestures instead?

japanese:
なるほど、それは一理ありますね。
ボディランゲージは万国共通と言いますし。
translation:
I see, that makes sense.
They say body language is universal.

japanese:
いやいや、言語と非言語コミュニケーションじゃ
意思疎通のレベルに違いがありすぎるだろ？
translation:
No, no, there are so many differences
in the level of communication
between verbal and nonverbal communication, right?

japanese:
いえいえ！
そこは努力と熱意でなんとかなりますとも！
translation: No way! We can manage with effort and enthusiasm!

japanese:
（ええ……。
　これは二乃じゃなくて四葉なような……）
translation:
(Hmm...
 This doesn't feel like Nino,
 but more like Yotsuba...)

japanese:
ではさっそく、私のジェスチャーが
店員さんに通じるか試してみますね！
translation:
Alright then,
let me try using my gestures
to communicate with the shop clerk!

japanese:
えっ、ちょっと待ってください！
それはさすがに不安な気が……！？
translation: Wait, hold on! Wouldn't that be a little unsettling...?!

japanese:
（行っちまったが……
　いや、本当にやる気じゃないよな？）
translation:
(She's already gone...
 Oh no, she's not really going to do that, is she?)
